quizzes.title: History Quiz: Maine and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, nickname, pingyao. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What nickname has been given to the U.S. state of Maine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pine Tree State

questions.question: The U.S. state of Maine became the leading producer and exporter of this product for the United Sates.
Which of these American actors was born in the U.S. state of Maine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patrick Dempsey

questions.question: The Latin state motto of the U.S. state of Maine is Dirigo. What does this mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I lead

questions.question: Mount Lu is part of what Chinese national park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lushan National Park

questions.question: According to the most popular theory, the U.S. state of Maine was named after which of the following.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A French province

questions.question: What is the name of the state capital of the U.S. state of Maine?
What is the largest city in the U.S. state of Maine?
Which of these statements about the U.S. state of Maine is true?

options.text: Maine is the U.S. state with most factories per capita.
Maine is one of the only two U.S. states that border only one other state.
Maine is the smallest U.S. state in terms of territory.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: The Mogao Caves form a system of Buddhist temples.
The Wolong National Nature Reserve was set up to save the declining giant panda population.
Many of the novels of this popular author are set in the U.S. state of Maine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen King

questions.question: What is the nickname of the ancient Chinese city Pingyao?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turtle Town

questions.question: Guilin is a city located on the Li River.
What is the state animal of the U.S. state of Maine?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Thanksgiving and Thanksgiving Day
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pilgrims, josepha. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What song, related to Thanksgiving, is a satirical musical monologue based on a true story that began on Thanksgiving Day in 1965?

options.text: Over the River and through the Woods

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alices Restaurant

questions.question: What statement is true about Sarah Josepha Hale, the woman who promoted the idea of a national Thanksgiving Day?

options.text: She wrote a letter to George Washington proposing the observance of Thanksgiving as a unified national holiday.
She is the author of the nursery rhyme Mary Had a Little Lamb.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She is the author of the nursery rhyme Mary Had a Little Lamb.

questions.question: Who captained the Mayflower on the transatlantic voyage from Southampton, England to Plymouth, Massachusetts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Jones

questions.question: Which of these is another name for the cornucopia, the symbol of plenty that came to be associated with Thanksgiving and the harvest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horn of Amalthea

questions.question: This island nation, which was the target of a US-led invasion in 1983, observes a national holiday of Thanksgiving Day on 25 October.

Franksgiving is a portmanteau word coined by Atlantic City mayor Thomas Taggart to deride a Thanksgiving Holiday which was held a week earlier than usual. The term was derived from the name of what famous person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: President Franklin D. Roosevelt

questions.question: The Wild Turkey, which is native to North America, belongs to what genus of birds?
A Thanksgiving Day service is held in Leiden, a place where the Pilgrims stopped on their way to the New World. Where is Leiden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in the Netherlands

questions.question: What founding father considered the turkey a much more respectable bird than the bald eagle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Franklin

questions.question: What was the name of the first Native American to make contact with the Pilgrims after their first winter in the New World?
Who wrote and directed Hannah and Her Sisters, a comedy-drama movie which tells intertwined stories beginning and ending with a family Thanksgiving dinner?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woody Allen

questions.question: Who performed and co-wrote The Thanksgiving Song, which revolves around the repetition of the word turkey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam Sandler

questions.question: George Washington proclaimed a Thanksgiving in December 1777 as a celebration honoring this event.

options.text: the defeat of the British at Saratoga
the defeat of the British at Yorktown
the signing of the Treaty of Paris
the signing of the Declaration of Independence

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the defeat of the British at Saratoga

questions.question: Buy Nothing Day is an international day of protest against consumerism, typically observed on the Friday after American Thanksgiving in North America and on the following day internationally. Where was the first Buy Nothing Day organized?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vancouver, Canada

questions.question: The first documented Thanksgiving ceremony in what was to become the USA took place in 1565 when a group of Spanish settlers held a mass for their safe delivery to the New World. What present day state did they land in?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Nickname and Prague
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What conference does the University of Central Arkansas play in?
The Old Town, or Staré Město, is a medieval settlement of Prague, Czech Republic.
Northwest Arkansas Community College is located in what northwest Arkansas city?
Who designed the main museum building of the National Museum in Prague?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josef Schultz

questions.question: What is the nickname of the University of Arkansas at Monticello?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boll Weevils

questions.question: What is the University of Arkansas at Fort Smith nicknamed?
Powering minds is the motto of what Arkansas school?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arkansas State

questions.question: What is the University of Arkansas nickname?
Prague Castle has been the residence of the Kings of Bohemia, Holy Roman Emperors and presidents of Czechoslovakia and the Czech Republic.
What is the nickname of Arkansas Techs mens athletic teams?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wonder Boys

questions.question: What is the nickname of Ouachita Baptist Universitys athletic teams?
John Brown Universitys basketball team is nicknamed the Golden Hawks.
The famous Charles Bridge in Prague was constructed in the 18h century.
What is/are the color/s of Hendrix College?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orange and Black

questions.question: What statement is true about the Prague Astronomical Clock?

options.text: It has an astronomical dial, representing the position of the Sun and Moon in the sky.
It shows the figures of the 12 Apostles.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Prague and Topkapi Palace
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, troja, rooms. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Topkapi Palace is located in Istanbul.
The dancing House in  Prague, Czech Republic was named “Ginger and Fred”.
The Topkapi Palace is an example of Ottoman architecture and what other architectural style?
There is a circumcision room in one of Topkapi Palaces courtyards.
The Powder Tower is a Gothic tower in Prague.
On what river is Prague situated?
The famous Topkapi dagger is ornamented with large emeralds.
The Topkapi palace has asymmetrical design.
The Topkapi Palace has a large collection of porcelain, robes, weapons, shields, armor and what else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: How many rooms did the Imperial Harem at Topkapi palace contain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: more than 400

questions.question: The Topkapi Palace is surrounded by sea on three sides.
Karlštejn Castle in Prague was founded by Charles IV, Holy Roman Emperor in the 16th century.
Which courtyard of Topkapi palace is known as Court of the Janissaries or the Parade Court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Courtyard

questions.question: Troja Palace is a Gothic palace in the Czech capital, Prague.
The Topkapi Palace was constructed in 1765.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Mexico City and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following are featured in the Columna de la Independencia in Mexico City?

options.text: four bronze sculptures, which symbolize Law, War, Justice and Peace
a group of marble statues of some of the heroes of the War of Independence.
a bronze statue of a giant lion led by a child

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: Patong Beach is located on the west coast of Phuket Island.
How many temples were built as part of Templo Mayor, which is located in present day Mexico City?
Much of the building materials of the National Palace of Mexico are from the original palace that belonged to Moctezuma II.
During the Mexican-American War, General John A. Quitman became the second American to ever rule from the National Palace of Mexico.
In Mexico City there is a statue honoring Charles IV.
Phuket is located in Andaman Sea near southern Thailand.
Columna de la Independencia, known as El Angel, was built to commemorate the centennial of the beginning of Mexicos War of Independence.
This Mexican Emperor and his wife established their Imperial Residence at Chapultepec Castle in 1864.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maximilian I of Mexico

questions.question: The Chapultepec Castle in Mexico City has been used as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This national park, where sea turtles lay their eggs, is located on the northwestern coast of Phuket Island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sirinat National Park

questions.question: What kind of islands are there around Phuket Island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coral islands

questions.question: The old name of Phuket is Talang, which means sea nose.
The Plaza de la Constitución, located in the historic center of Mexico City, has been known as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Tenochtitlan in Mexico City was dedicated to Huitzilopochtli, god of war and Tlaloc, god of rain and agriculture.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: South Africa and Phuket Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mining, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official language spoken by the population of the Republic of South Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What small country is located entirely within the territory of the Republic of South Africa?
The first European settlers arrived in Phuket in the 16th century. What nationality were they?
The adherents of what religion form the largest group in the Republic of South Africa according to the 2001 census?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zion Christianity

questions.question: What is the translation of the national motto of the Republic of South Africa, !ke e: ǀxarra ǁke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unity in diversity

questions.question: Tin mining used to be a major source of income for Phuket Island.
South Africa is among the top ten producers in the world of which of the following?
What is the largest city in the Republic of South Africa?
Which of these statements is true about the national anthem of South Africa?

options.text: It was composed by a French poet.
It consists of only one verse.
It doesnt finish in the home key.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It doesnt finish in the home key.

questions.question: What is the most popular sport among the people of South Africa?
Phuket Island has a tropical climate.
What city is the capital of the Republic of South Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What disaster occurred on Phuket Island in 2004?
Which of these endangered rabbit species is not endemic to South Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scrub Hare

questions.question: The majority of the population on Phuket Island is Muslim.
